solution_line_template: Since each water bottle has a capacity of {bottle_capacity} liters, when filled up to {fill_fraction} of capacity, each carries {fill_fraction}*{bottle_capacity} = <<{fill_fraction}*{bottle_capacity}={liters_per_bottle}>>{liters_per_bottle} liters of water.

If there are {bottles_per_box} bottles of water in each box, the number of liters the water bottles in a box are carrying is {bottles_per_box}*{liters_per_bottle} = <<{bottles_per_box}*{liters_per_bottle}={liters_per_box}>>{liters_per_box} liters.
In {num_boxes} boxes containing bottled water, the total number of liters in the water bottles is {liters_per_box}*{num_boxes} =<<{liters_per_box}*{num_boxes}={total_liters}>>{total_liters} liters.
